reviewText: I thought this was a good video, but limited in it's usefulness.  My daughter is only 9, and I figured this would be perfect for her, but it was so brief, and was over so quickly without going into so many other details of horse life that we were both disappointed.  I wish it was indicated somewhere that the video is only half an hour long.  So yes, it's good, but just not what I had expected.  If you go buy it, knowing that, it's different and your expectations aren't as high.

In a society where growing young minds are routinely exposed to mind numbing rubbish thinly disguised as entertainment, it was a pleasure to view a work from a promising young producer aimed at nourishing the brain as opposed to sedating it. Inspiring and heartfelt, a Young American Rider is the first of what I hope will be a series of productions from Doodlebug Inc.
